verses.roman:
yudhiṣṭhira uvāca
kiṁ na ācaritaṁ śreyo
na vedāham adhīśvara
yogeśvarāṇāṁ durdarśo
yan no dṛṣṭaḥ ku-medhasām

synonyms: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ uvāca—Yudhiṣṭhira said; kim—what; naḥ—by us; ācaritam—performed; śreyaḥ—pious work; na veda—do not know; aham—I; adhīśvara—O supreme controller; yoga—of mystic yoga; īśvarāṇām—by the masters; durdarśaḥ—rarely seen; yat—that; naḥ—by us; dṛṣṭaḥ—seen; ku-medhasam—who are unintelligent.
translation: King Yudhiṣṭhira said: O supreme controller, I do not know what pious deeds we fools have done so that we can see You, whom the masters of yogic perfection rarely see.
